packageJson.name: dev-404-page
packageJson.description: Internal plugin to add a 404 page in development with helpful information
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: load-babel-config
packageJson.description: Internal plugin that handles loading Babel configs
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: internal-data-bridge
packageJson.description: An internal Gatsby plugin which creates data nodes from internal data
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: prod-404
packageJson.description: Internal plugin to detect various flavors of 404 pages and ensure there's a 404.html path created as well to ensure compatability with static hosts
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: webpack-theme-component-shadowing
packageJson.description: An internal Gatsby plugin which handles configuring webpack to ensure theme components fall back from the user's site to theme modules.
packageJson.author: Chris Biscardi <chris@christopherbiscardi.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-react-helmet
packageJson.description: Manage document head data with react-helmet. Provides drop-in server rendering support for Gatsby.
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <matthews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-source-filesystem
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin which parses files within a directory for further parsing by other plugins
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-transformer-sharp
packageJson.description: Gatsby transformer plugin for images using Sharp
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-sharp
packageJson.description: Wrapper of the Sharp image manipulation library for Gatsby plugins
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-manifest
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin which adds a manifest.webmanifest to make sites progressive web apps
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-styled-components
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin to add support for styled components
packageJson.author: Guten Ye <ywzhaifei@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-source-filesystem
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin which parses files within a directory for further parsing by other plugins
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-starter-styled-components
packageJson.description: A simple starter to get up and developing quickly with Gatsby and styled-components
packageJson.author: Blake Noll <nollblake@gmail.com>

packageJson.name: gatsby-plugin-page-creator
packageJson.description: Gatsby plugin that automatically creates pages from React components in specified directories
packageJson.author: Kyle Mathews <mathews.kyle@gmail.com>

internal.content:
---
title: Button
---

import { Button } from 'rimble-ui'

# Button documentation

Use the`Button`component when you want users to perform an action like connecting their Ethereum account or starting a transaction. It contains a label with an optional icon before or after the label. It maps to a`<button type='button'>`element and extends`[Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation)`.

*Want to understand best practices for using this component?*Read`[Button`design guidelines](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-buttons--design-guidelines)

**Import component**

```jsx
import { Button } from 'rimble-ui';
```

## Examples

Different ways to use the `Button` component

### Default button

Use to show users the primary action(s) they can take from the screen they're on.



```js is=react-live
<Button>
  Connect wallet
</Button>
```


### Outline button

Use for secondary actions

e251e1c4-965b-55e1-b5fa-5accf719340a.rawBody:

# Button documentation

Use the`Button`component when you want users to perform an action like connecting their Ethereum account or starting a transaction. It contains a label with an optional icon before or after the label. It maps to a`<button type='button'>`element and extends`[Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation)`.

*Want to understand best practices for using this component?*Read`[Button`design guidelines](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-buttons--design-guidelines)

**Import component**

```jsx
import { Button } from 'rimble-ui';
```

## Examples

### Default button

Use to show users the primary action(s) they can take from the screen they're on.



```js is=react-live
<Button>
  Connect wallet
</Button>
```


### Outline button

Use for secondary actions

internal.content:
--- title: Connection Banner --- import ConnectionBanner from '@rimble/connection-banner'; # Connection Banner Web3 React component built with Rimble UI that will display an informative banner when the user is not in a web3 capable browser, or when the current browser does not have a wallet available, or when the current ethereum network does not match the required network. ## Installation Install the package in your project directory with: ```sh // with npm npm install @rimble/connection-banner // with yarn yarn add @rimble/connection-banner ``` ## Usage Example ### Default messages ```js is=react-live ; ``` ### Custom messages ```js is=react-live {{ notWeb3CapableBrowserMessage: (

Not a web3 capable browser

), noNetworkAvailableMessage: (

No Ethereum network available

), onWrongNetworkMessage: (

On wrong Ethereum network

), }} ``` ## Props | Name | Type | Default | Description | | ------------------------------ | ------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `currentNetwork` | integer | none | The network ID that the user is connected to, if available | | `requiredNetwork` | integer | none | The network ID that the dApp requires to function | | `onWeb3Fallback` | boolean | false | Set to `true` when you connect to a smart contract via a provider like infura | | `notWeb3CapableBrowserMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `notWeb3CapableBrowser` condition is met | | `noNetworkAvailableMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `noNetworkAvailable` condition is met | | `onWrongNetworkMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `onWrongNetwork` condition is met | ## Default Messages ### notWeb3CapableBrowserMessage > Your browser doesn't support our blockchain features > > Switch to either Brave, FireFox, Opera, or Chrome to continue ### noNetworkAvailableMessage > Install MetaMask to use our blockchain features > > This will let you connect using an Ethereum public address > > `installMetaMaskButton` ### onWrongNetworkMessage > Switch to the `requiredNetworkName` Ethereum network in MetaMask > > Change your network in your MetaMask extension. You're currently on `currentNetworkName` ## Documentation [Documentation](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/) ### Issues [Open an issue](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/issues) for any bugs or feature requests ### Contributing We are open source and welcome your [contributions](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/CONTRIBUTIONS.md) ! ### License MIT [ConsenSys](https://github.com/ConsenSys)

c653bbb7-310e-5b92-b541-499d6119a6b5.rawBody:

Not a web3 capable browser

), noNetworkAvailableMessage: (

), onWrongNetworkMessage: (

), }} ``` ## Props | Name | Type | Default | Description | | ------------------------------ | ------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | `currentNetwork` | integer | none | The network ID that the user is connected to, if available | | `requiredNetwork` | integer | none | The network ID that the dApp requires to function | | `onWeb3Fallback` | boolean | false | Set to `true` when you connect to a smart contract via a provider like infura | | `notWeb3CapableBrowserMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `notWeb3CapableBrowser` condition is met | | `noNetworkAvailableMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `noNetworkAvailable` condition is met | | `onWrongNetworkMessage` | node | see default messages | Markup that will be rendered when the `onWrongNetwork` condition is met | ## Default Messages ### notWeb3CapableBrowserMessage > Your browser doesn't support our blockchain features > > Switch to either Brave, FireFox, Opera, or Chrome to continue ### noNetworkAvailableMessage > Install MetaMask to use our blockchain features > > This will let you connect using an Ethereum public address > > `installMetaMaskButton` ### onWrongNetworkMessage > Switch to the `requiredNetworkName` Ethereum network in MetaMask > > Change your network in your MetaMask extension. You're currently on `currentNetworkName` ## Documentation [Documentation](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/) ### Issues [Open an issue](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/issues) for any bugs or feature requests ### Contributing We are open source and welcome your [contributions](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/CONTRIBUTIONS.md) ! ### License MIT [ConsenSys](https://github.com/ConsenSys)

internal.content:
---
title: Flash
---

import { Flash } from 'rimble-ui';

# Flash banner

Created: Apr 23, 2019 1:45 AM
Design guidelines: Flash design guidelines
Tags: UI components

# Flash documentation

Use the `Flash` component for messages that persist but don't block the user. For example, you may want to let users know they're on the wrong network but allow them to continue browsing until they try to connect. The Flash renders a responsive box-model layout component. Inherits props from [Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation) component.

*Want to understand best practices for using `Flash`*? [Read the design guidelines](#)

**Import component**

${`import { Flash } from 'rimble-ui';`}

## Examples

Different ways to use the `Flash` component

### Default



### Info

### Success



### Warning

### Danger

## Accessibility

- Critical and warning banners have a role="alert"
- All other banners have a role="status"
- Banner containers have a tabindex="0" and display a visible keyboard focus indicator.
- Banners use aria-describedby to describe their purpose to assistive technologies when they're announced or receive focus. All of the banner content is used for the aria-describedby.

## Component props

[Untitled](./-b20e9dc6-7549-46de-b460-5215adb2ff90.csv)

## Styled-system props

Flash uses all the style props from `[Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation)`.

---

internal.content:
---
title: Network Indicator
---

`import NetworkIndicator from '@rimble/network-indicator';`

`<NetworkIndicator currentNetwork={1} />`

`<NetworkIndicator currentNetwork={1} requiredNetwork={3} />`

# @rimble/network-indicator

Web3 React component built with Rimble UI that will display the current ethereum network name based on a given network ID.

## Installation

Install the package in your project directory with:

```sh
// with npm
npm install @rimble/network-indicator

// with yarn
yarn add @rimble/network-indicator
```

## Usage Example

```jsx
import NetworkIndicator from '@rimble/network-indicator';

<NetworkIndicator currentNetwork={3} requiredNetwork={1} />;
```

## Props

| Name              | Type    | Default | Description                                                |
| ----------------- | ------- | ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------- |
| `currentNetwork`  | integer | none    | The network ID that the user is connected to, if available |
| `requiredNetwork` | integer | none    | The network ID that the dApp requires to function          |

## Documentation

[Documentation](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/)

### Issues

[Open an issue](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/issues) for any bugs or feature requests

### Contributing

We are open source and welcome your [contributions](https://github.com/ConsenSys/rimble-web3-components/CONTRIBUTIONS.md) !

### License

MIT  [ConsenSys](https://github.com/ConsenSys)

4a512409-6865-5cc4-8473-799d121a273d.rawBody:

internal.content:
---
title: "Checkbox"
---

import { Checkbox } from 'rimble-ui'

# Checkboxes

Created: Apr 23, 2019 1:44 AM
Design guidelines: Checkbox design guidelines
Tags: UI components

# Checkbox documentation

Use the`Checkbox`component when users can choose 0 or more than 1 options from a list.`Checkbox`maps to a checkbox input and a label.

*Want to understand best practices for using `Checkbox`?*[Read the design guidelines](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-form-checkboxes--design-guidelines)

**Import component**

    import { Checkbox } from 'rimble-ui';

## Examples

Different ways to use the `Checkbox` component

### Default checkbox

<Checkbox
label="Checkbox default"
required="true"
/>

    <Checkbox
      label="Checkbox default"
      required="true"
    />

### Checked checkbox

<Checkbox
checked
label="Checkbox checked"
required="true"
/>

    <Checkbox
      checked
      label="Checkbox checked"
      required="true"
    />

### Disabled checkbox

<Checkbox
disabled
label="Checkbox disabled"
required="true"
/>

    <Checkbox
      disabled
      label="Checkbox disabled"
      required="true"
    />

### Checked and disabled

<Checkbox
checked
disabled
label="Checkbox checked disabled"
my={2}
required="true"
/>

    <Checkbox
      checked
      disabled
      label="Checkbox checked disabled"
      my={2}
      required="true"
    />

## Component props

`Checkbox`will pass any props that are defined on its component and uses the following:

[Untitled](https://www.notion.so/79d53de0f6cc410396549389839d5e8e)

## Styled-system props

`Checkbox` uses all the style props from `[Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation)`.

---

[Checkbox design guidelines](https://www.notion.so/c5885d2c772c4b5e9ac9883012d91a50)

internal.content:
---
title: Input
---

import { Input, Form } from 'rimble-ui'

# Inputs

Created: Apr 23, 2019 1:44 AM
Design guidelines: Input design guidelines
Tags: UI components

# Input documentation

The`Input`component provides a styled version of HTML`<input>`.

*Want to understand best practices for using `Input`?* [Read thedesign guidelines](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-form-inputs--design-guidelines)

**Import component**

    import { Input } from 'rimble-ui';

## Examples

Different ways to use the `Input` component in your product. Note: these examples use the `[Field](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-form-field--documentation)` component to render associated labels.

### Placeholder

Adds placeholder text to suggest the type of input expected.

<Input type="text" required="true" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" />

    <Input type="text" required="true" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" />

### Disabled input

<Input type="text" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" required="true" disabled />

    <Input type="text" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" required="true" disabled />

### Optional input

Renders "(Optional)" next to the label.

<Input type="text" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" />

    <Input type="text" placeholder="e.g. My hodl wallet" />

### Text input

Brings up a standard keyboard.

<Form.Input type="text" required="true" placeholder="e.g. 0xAc03BB73b6a9e108530AFf4Df5077c2B3D481e5A" />

    <Form.Input type="text" required="true" placeholder="e.g. 0xAc03BB73b6a9e108530AFf4Df5077c2B3D481e5A" />

### Email input

Give you an @ on your keyboard.

<Form.Input type="email" required="true" placeholder="you@example.com" />

    <Form.Input type="email" required="true" placeholder="you@example.com" />

### Password input

Masks any input.

<Form.Input type="password" required="true" />

    <Form.Input type="password" required="true" />

### Number input

Opens the number page of your keyboard.

<Form.Input type="number" required="true" placeholder="e.g. 123" />

    <Form.Input type="number" required="true" placeholder="e.g. 123" />

### Search input

Allows users to quickly remove a search term.

<Form.Input type="search" required="true" placeholder="e.g. Ethereum" />

    <Form.Input type="search" required="true" placeholder="e.g. Ethereum" />

### Telephone input

Brings up the telephone keyboard.

<Form.Input type="tel" required="true" placeholder="e.g. +445575242519" />

    <Form.Input type="tel" required="true" placeholder="e.g. +445575242519" />

### URL input

Bring up a url keyboard.

<Form.Input type="url" required="true" placeholder="e.g. rimble.consensys.design" />

    <Form.Input type="url" required="true" placeholder="e.g. rimble.consensys.design" />

## Component props

`Input`will pass any props that are defined on its component and uses the following:

[Untitled](https://www.notion.so/223a5e36dcb54b1ba7d925eb9542648b)

## Styled-system props

`Input`uses all the style props from`[Box](https://consensys.github.io/rimble-ui/?path=/story/components-layout-box--documentation)`, but also includes these:

[Untitled](https://www.notion.so/3473c82256dc4738ababac974b831347)

---

[Input design guidelines](https://www.notion.so/d7a3ebe706574c90bf0b610655592020)
